intro: Bonania erythrosperma, commonly known as the red-seed bonania, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small, red seeds. Bonania erythrosperma is often found in moist, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
